frontmatter.title: Free Energy Profiles and Equilibrium Constants

children.value:
Free energy profiles and PMFs link probabilities to partition functions, allowing computation of equilibrium constants for binding reactions.
Care must be taken when connecting to standard free energies, as
equilibrium constants in statistical mechanics depend on the reference concentration and are dimensionless, while experimental

This formulation underpins the double--decoupling method (DDM), in which the ratio of partition functions is obtained by decoupling the ligand at the binding site and in the bulk. Boresch et al. introduced a minimal set of six restraints (one distance

The DDM thus provides a general alchemical framework---encompassing
confine-and-release variants---whose rigor relies on the proper
application and unbiasing of restraints
